page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The information contained within these pages was compiled by the pupils & staff of Hullavington Primary School during the Summer of 1985. To decide the catagories of Land Cover most of the ground within the the area was walked over or examined from the roadside. Visits were made to the local R.A.F. Station, farms and other interesting places. Surveys were made, either by questionnaires within the school, or by counting items outside. The telephone was used to ask questions of more distant people. This survey marked the first attempt at the school to use a micro-computer for information storage. The staff involved were Graham Priest (Headmaster), Judith Sexton (Deputy Head), Ann Sneyd, John Lewis, Susan Fenner & Janice Courts (Secretary).
